By Will Feuer Shares of Microsoft notched a new all-time high in intraday trading, a sign that investor enthusiasm for companies with exposure to artificial intelligence hasn't dimmed. Microsoft stock rose 2.6% to $425.69 in morning trading Thursday. Shares are up 63% from a year ago. The stock was the best performer in both the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average Thursday morning. The company said Wednesday that it would make its artificial intelligence product Copilot for Security available worldwide next month, its latest bid to roll out its new AI products to more enterprise customers.
